mediautil.gen.directio
Interface IterativeWriter

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicJpeg, LLJTran
public interface IterativeWriter

Interface specifying write to a stream in small chunks. This interface specifies an Object to write to an OutputStream in small chunks. An IterativeWriter class can support the directio package's feature to provide an InputStream to read directly the data written by an IterativeWriter.

See Also:
mediautil.gen.directio, InStreamFromIterativeWriter

Method Summary
 int nextWrite(int numBytes)
          Specifies that numBytes bytes are to be written.
 

Method Detail

nextWrite

int nextWrite(int numBytes)
              throws IOException
Specifies that numBytes bytes are to be written. The OutputStream to Write to should be stored in the implementing class.

Parameters:
numBytes - Number of bytes to write. This is only indicative. The implementor may write more or less. Writing too less impacts performance due to repeated nextWrite calls. Writing too much more than numBytes leads to performance impact due to buffer reallocation.

The OutputStream returned for use by an IterativeWriter by directio's classes implement ByteCounter which can help in keeping track of the number of bytes written or remaining during a nextWrite call.

Returns:
IterativeReader.CONTINUE to indicate that there is more to be written and IterativeReader.STOP to indicate that the IterativeWriter is done with writing.
Throws:
IOException - In case of an error during write.
